general_advisory: Drain out excess water from rice nurseries & jute field. Postpone irrigation, intercultural operations & fertilizer application to the standing crops in upcoming 3 days. Farmers are advised to initiate transplanting of paddy by using rainwater/canal water & farm pond or any other nearby water sources.

advisory: Considering the anticipated rainfall, the farmer should start transplanting of rice after nursery treatment with Granular insecticide like Cartap hydrochloride (4G) @ 100 grams/1 decimal nursery or Fipronil 0.3 g @ 100g/1 decimal nursery area seven days before uprooting of seedlings.
Under the prevailing weather conditions, blast & BLB incidence are observed in rice. Spray Tricyclazole @ 1gm/lit of water along with Plantomycin @ 1gm/lit of water to minimize the disease incidence.
Plant 2 to 3 seedlings/hill at shallow depth in an erect manner with spacing of 20 X 15cm for long duration and 20 X 10cm for medium duration varieties.
Apply pre-emergence weedicide Bensulfuron methyl+Pretilachlor@10kg/ha or Pyrazosulfuron ethyl @20g a.i./ha at 3 to 4 days after transplanting (DAT) with mixing 25kg dry sand.
Recent rain will increase weed population in jute, to control grass weeds apply Quizalfop-pethyl @2ml/litre of water.

Current rainy weather is favorable for the attack of insect pests like semilooper, Bihari hair caterpillar, and other foliage feeders. To control these insects, spray Lamba cyhalothrin 4.9CS @ 250 ml/acre.
Wrapping and propping should be done when the crop becomes 4-5 months old in medium and late duration varieties.
To control early shot borer in sugarcane, foliar spray of Fipronil 5SC @400 ml/acre is advised.
To prevent wilting or partial wilting in brinjal, drain the excess water from the field. Apply Neem or Karanjaa cake @ 1g/acre, Drenching of Tebuconazole @ 1ml/liter can be recommended.

To control Fruit and shoot borer in Brinjal and Okra, spray Neem-based pesticide 1500ppm @600ml/acre at initial stages. If the pests continue ETL, go for an alternate spray of Spinosad 45% SC @70ml/acre and Emamectin benzoate @ 80 g /acre at 15 days interval.
For the control of sucking pests in Chilli, Okra, Cowpea & Cucurbits, spraying of Thiametoxam 25g@70 g/acre or imidacloprid @80 ml/acre may be recommended.
Carp such as Rohu, Catla, and Mrigal, which grow rapidly, should be stocked in a certain ratio of 4:3:3 to increase the benefits.
Generally, a density of 5,000 fingerlings/ha is kept as a standard stocking.

Groundnut oil cake and rice bran are given in the same ratio @ 5% of the total biomass of stocking material. Cow dung, urea, and superphosphate should be applied to increase pond quality. In 8-10 months, fishes attain their marketable size.
If the animals have not yet been vaccinated against FMD, Haemorrhagic Septicaemia, Black Quarter, Enterotoxemia, etc., these must be done.
